sen.j: 和田 賢秀（にぎた かたひで、？ - 貞和4年/正平 (日本)3年1月5日 (旧暦)（1348年2月4日））は、南北朝時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Katahide WADA (? - February 4, 1348) was busho (a Japanese military commander) in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.
Katahide NIGITA (year of birth unknown - February 4, 1348) was busho (a Japanese military commander) in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.
sen.cmt: WADA→NIGITA,?→year of birth unknown と修正しました。
sen.e: Katahide NIGITA (year of birth unknown - February 4, 1348) was busho (a Japanese military commander) in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

sen.j: またはけんしゅうとも呼ばれる。
sen.e: He is also called Kenshu.

sen.j: 楠木正季の五男（末男）で、楠木正成の甥。
sen.e: He was the fifth (youngest) son of Masasue KUSUNOKI and a nephew of Masashige KUSUNOKI.
He was the fifth (youngest) son of Masasue KUSUNOKI and a nephew of Masashige KUSUNOKI.

sen.j: 湊川の戦いで伯父・父らが散華した後、楠木一門の棟梁となったいとこの楠木正行に従い、共に勢力を回復していった。
sen.e: After his uncle and father died in the Battle of Minato-gawa River, he was subordinated to his cousin, Masatsura KUSUNOKI who became the toryo (head) of the Kusunoki family, and regained their power together.

After his uncle and father died in the Battle of Minato-gawa River, he was subordinated to his cousin, Masatsura KUSUNOKI who became the toryo (head) of the Kusunoki family, and regained their power together.

sen.j: 楠木一族の中でも武勇の誉れ高く、正行に従い常に参戦している。
sen.e: He had the reputation of being brave in the Kusunoki family, and always followed Masatsura to join battles.
He was honorably brave among the Kusunoki family, and always followed Masatsura to join the battles.
sen.cmt: 前半部分を文脈より修正しました。the を挿入しました。
sen.e: He was honorably brave among the Kusunoki family, and always followed Masatsura to join the battles.

sen.j: 貞和3年（1347年）に紀伊国の隅田一族を、また河内国で細川顕氏や山名時氏を打ち破った。
sen.e: In 1347, he defeated the Sumida family of Kii Province, and Akiuji HOSOKAWA and Tokiuji YAMANA in Kawachi Province.
In 1347, he defeated the Sumida family of Kii Province, and Akiuji HOSOKAWA and Tokiuji YAMANA in Kawachi Province.

sen.j: 貞和4年（1348年）正月、四條畷の戦いで正行と高師直で戦い敗死した。
sen.e: On January in 1348, he fought with Masatsura against KO no Moronao at the Battle of Shijonawate, and died in the battle.
sen.cmt: 「正行と共に高師直と戦い」だと思いましたのでそのように訳しています。
sen.e: On January in 1348, he fought with Masatsura against KO no Moronao at the Battle of Shijonawate, and died in the battle.

sen.j: かつて味方であった湯浅氏の者に背後から討たれたという。
sen.e: He was attacked from behind by the army of the Yuasa clan that was formerly on his side.
He was attacked from behind by the army of the Yuasa clan that was a former ally.
sen.cmt: formerly on his side→a former ally と修正しました。
sen.e: He was attacked from behind by the army of the Yuasa clan that was a former ally.

sen.j: 時に齢20前後だったという。
sen.e: He was around 20 years old.
He is said have been about 20 years old at that time.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: He is said have been about 20 years old at that time.

sen.j: 討死の際に敵将の首に噛み付き睨んで放さず、敵はそれが因で死んだと言う逸話が残っている。
sen.e: According to the anecdote, when he was dying, he bit an enemy's neck and glared at him without releasing it, which caused the enemy to die.
sen.cmt: 「歯噛様」は直訳です。一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 土地の人々は賢秀の霊のことを「歯噛様」として祭っている。
sen.e: The local residents worshiped the soul of Katahide as "Hagami-sama (teeth bite)".
